meanings.definition: A person who engages in fights or arguments.
meanings.sent1: The scrappers in the playground were shouting at each other.
meanings.sent2: The two scrappers couldn't agree on which movie to watch.
meanings.sent3: The scrappers at the debate club always had something to argue about.
meanings.sent4: The scrappers in the courtroom battled with words instead of fists.
meanings.sent5: The image of the scrappers arguing fiercely stayed in my mind.

meanings.sent1: The scrappers on his plate were too much for him to finish.
meanings.sent2: The cat eagerly ate up the scrappers from the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: The dog happily gobbled up the scrappers that fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The birds outside chirped excitedly over the scrappers left in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the scrappers in the trash bin attracted raccoons at night.

meanings.definition: A person who collects scrap metal for recycling.
meanings.sent1: The scrappers drove around the neighborhood looking for metal to recycle.
meanings.sent2: The scrappers sorted through the junkyard to find valuable metal pieces.
meanings.sent3: The scrappers joked about turning trash into treasure with their metal finds.
meanings.sent4: The scrappers' truck was filled with metal ready for recycling.
meanings.sent5: The sound of scrappers collecting metal echoed through the streets.
